page.title: 03Villages and Hamlets cont.
page.content: {Tresham.}A small village of about three dozen houses, with a church, telephone box, letter box in a wall and a house which sells milk and soft drinks. The village is on a hill with a valley sloping away to the south- west. {Wortley}is between Wotton-under-Edge and Alderley. There are only about 16 houses. Most of the cottages are detatched, one of them is thatched. The houses are very old, some are over two hundred years old. There aren't many children living in Wortley, it is a very quiet place. There is a place there called Park Farm, it is being rennovated because it is old and falling apart. Wortley isn't a very big place but a lovely view. It is a hamlet because it does not have a church. It has a telephone box and a letter box in a wall.
